meanings.definition: To extract money or goods from (someone) by fraudulent means.
meanings.sent1: The scam artist mulcted unsuspecting victims out of their life savings.
meanings.sent2: The con artist mulcted the elderly couple by pretending to be a financial advisor.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky thief mulcted the tourists by selling them fake souvenirs.
meanings.sent4: The cunning fraudster mulcted the naive customers with his elaborate scheme.
meanings.sent5: The dishonest salesman mulcted customers by overcharging for low-quality products.

meanings.sent1: The dishonest contractor mulcted his clients by charging for unnecessary repairs.
meanings.sent2: The fraudulent company mulcted investors out of millions of dollars.
meanings.sent3: The tricky magician mulcted the audience by pretending to make things disappear.
meanings.sent4: The sly pickpocket mulcted unsuspecting pedestrians in the crowded market.
meanings.sent5: The deceptive fortune teller mulcted gullible customers by making false predictions.
